document_title: Gallbladder sludge: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Depending on the severity of gallbladder sludge stones, your doctor will prescribe appropriate treatment options. Some common methods commonly applied include: (2)
1. Build a healthy lifestyle and diet
Measures involving lifestyle changes and a healthy diet can help prevent gallbladder sludge stones from recurring. As follows:
Avoid alcohol abuse, it is best to abstain from alcohol completely.; Maintain a low-fat diet.; Avoid sudden, rapid weight gain or loss.; Focus on treating underlying medical conditions to improve overall health.
In some cases, gallbladder sludge stones can also be dissolved using medication. Patients should discuss carefully with their doctor to make a reasonable choice.
2. Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP)
Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) is a minimally invasive procedure performed for common bile duct stones. Accordingly, the doctor will use a flexible endoscope to pass through the mouth, into the duodenum to access the common bile duct and remove the stone. During this process, X-ray machines can be used in combination to help completely remove stones in the bile ducts.
With endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP), the patient may have to fast for a few hours before the procedure and need to change their diet afterward.
3. Surgery
If the patient has severe pain related to gallstone sludge or gallstones have formed, causing a series of other serious symptoms, surgery to remove the gallbladder will be indicated. This method is often given priority to people with good health. Surgery will require general anesthesia, with the patient in a state of complete sleep during the procedure.
Endoscopic removal of gallbladder sludge stones
